with the JRE on a different drive letter to the workspace (eg. JRE on D: and Workspace on C:),
clicking the "Source Attachment" button then "Workspace" correctly selects a workspace path.
However, after pressing OK in both the workspace path dialog and the source attachment dialog,
the edit JRE dialog incorrectly asserts that the selected source attachment does not exist.

The correct workspace path is displayed in both the error message and the "source attachment" field.

Selecting the same file using "External file" works as expected.

Selecting a resource from the Workspace means that the resource is local to the workspace. In your case, your resource is external to the workspace so you should use the "External File" type of attachment.
